definition: to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]

sentences.english: The three of them plodded up the hill in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 三個人在雪中一步一彎腰地爬山。

sentences.english: He bent over to scrape some dirt off his shoes.
sentences.chinese: 他彎腰刮掉鞋子上的塵土。

sentences.english: When he bent over, he split his pant .
sentences.chinese: 他一彎腰就把褲襠裂開了。

sentences.english: If you slouch forward when you run, you may be pulling too hard on your calf muscles.
sentences.chinese: 如果跑的時候向前彎腰，那你的腓腸肌會拉伸過量。

sentences.english: It stopped near the edge of the pool and bowed.
sentences.chinese: 它在水池邊附近停下，然後彎腰鞠躬。

sentences.english: You check to see exactly how much money you dropped before you bend to pick it up.
sentences.chinese: 彎腰撿錢之前，你先要確認一下自己究竟丟了多少錢。

sentences.english: Hitched to lines made of bamboo, straining with bent backs, their fingers almost touched the ground.
sentences.chinese: 縴夫扯着竹繩彎腰使勁，手指幾乎觸地。

sentences.english: Yet no one bent down to help him up.
sentences.chinese: 還是沒有一個人彎腰把老人扶起來。

sentences.english: I bent forward, my face in my hands to keep my skull from splitting open.
sentences.chinese: 我向前彎腰，手捂着臉來防止腦袋爆炸。

sentences.english: Thompson stoops to pick up an orange star.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆森彎腰建起了一個桔紅色的海星。

sentences.english: I couldn’t even bend down to tie my own shoes.
Chinese acrobats bent over backwards with giant porcelain vases balanced on their foreheads?Been there.
sentences.chinese: 中國的雜技演員頂着瓷碗向後彎腰及地。

sentences.english: She stooped to pick up the handkerchief and smoothed it out on the table.
sentences.chinese: 她彎腰撿起手帕在桌子上把它弄平。

sentences.english: If then I bend over and pick up a stick, he is instantly before me. The great thing has now happened. He has a mission.
sentences.chinese: 如果那時我彎腰拾起一根樹棍，他會立刻跑到我面前。

sentences.english: The booty bump hula hoop trick involves bending over and getting the hoop to spin vertically.
sentences.chinese: 呼啦圈的戰利品凸點伎倆涉及彎腰和得到垂直旋轉箍。

sentences.english: Bend down and keep the floor clean.

definition: to bow the head/to yield/to give in
to sway/to swing/to move back and forth/to oscillate
to bend/to curve around/curved/crooked/to wind/to warp
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
